page.title: 12The Village,Ayot St.Lawrence
page.content: Ayot St.Lawrence village is surrounded by peaceful countryside.It can only be be reached by narrow country lanes. In Winter the roads easily get blocked by snow so the village is secluded. It has a population of about 100 people.The majority of houses were built in the 15th-18th centuries. Originally many ofthe older houses were farm-workers' cottages which have been extended and modernised. In some cases several adjoining cottages have been converted into one dwelling. Only one new house has been built since 1950.Most of the gardens cover 1-3 acres. Most people choose to live in the area because it is peaceful with beautiful countryside and is near London. The villagers' main dislikes are:no public transport,and the narrow winding lanes,which are dangerous when visitors flock there.
